alert.note: Alert for Bronx; Kings; New York (Manhattan); Queens (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 30 at 9:01PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast New York, including the following counties, Bronx, Kings (Brooklyn), New York (Manhattan) and Queens. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 900 PM EDT, Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional heavy rainfall is possible in the next few hours and a flash flood warning may be needed. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Jamaica, Flatbush, Flushing, Mott Haven, East Tremont, Coney Island, Rockaway Beach, Crown Heights, Laguardia Airport, RFK Bridge, Midtown Manhattan, Kennedy Airport, Throgs Neck Bridge, The Verrazano Narrows Bridge, Harlem, Jackson Heights, Forest Hills, Canarsie, Bay Ridge and Astoria. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
